medical_history.history_of_present_illness: In May 2008, the patient was diagnosed with multiple emboli in bilateral pulmonary arteries and thrombosis in the left peroneal vein. Symptoms began with chest discomfort and light-headedness that led to hospital admission. Following treatment with anticoagulation, she underwent an urgent appendectomy and experienced an internal bleed requiring readmission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Depression, asthma, gastroesophageal reflux, mild chronic renal failure, glaucoma, hypothyroidism. Previous surgeries include appendectomy and partial thyroidectomy for a benign tumor.
medical_history.family_history: Family history shows no thrombosis. Multiple siblings and her mother had cancer including breast, pancreatic, gynecologic, and gastric malignancies, while her father had renal failure secondary to amyloidosis.
medical_history.social_history: Works as an office manager. Does not smoke and consumes alcohol occasionally.
